content.description: This was the "original Line" on this block. Starts on the rightside (east) of formation. SDS traverse over to the sculpted slopers on a bulge. Work this making a huge throw for a good jug. I would say this is the crux fight the pump! Work up on good but airy holds to the top out.
content.location: One of the first problems encountered when crossing the creek

content.description: Stand or sit on right angling rail. Trend right through a couple crimps before heading straight up on jugs to a tall-ish top out.Â
Starts standing on the boulder and makes a few moves on good but really dirty holds. This problem once it gets cleaned up a little more will be a nice warm up addition to the area.
content.location: across the marsh lands as seen from the road

content.description: Sharp steep good boulder problem. This is the farthest problem left when facing the wall. It starts on the same start holds as Tepidus. Reachy long moves on sharp holds brings you to better holds up high. Stays on you till the top.

The Swamp Boulder is a great wall that offers fun sculpted climbing. Great incuts and steep to slightly overhanging make this worth the 10 minute drive from Custer. Luke Kretchmar and Heath lille first looked at the possible wall. Cleaned and developed by Luke Kretchmar. Expect to be the only climbers in the area. Quite roadside bouldering with a nice stream running by. There are a few more obscure boulders in the area that with a little more clean up would be a fun circuit.
